definition[0]: if something is in hand, it is being done or dealt with
note[0]: take somebody in hand (=begin to deal with someone’s problems etc)
example[0]: Plans are in hand to perform ‘Oz’ next semester.
example[1]: Lisa seemed to have things in hand by the time he returned.
example[2]: Our officers have to concentrate 100 per cent on the task in hand.
definition[1]: if you work a week, a month etc in hand, you do not get paid until after you have worked two weeks, two months etc
definition[2]: if you have time, money etc in hand, you have it available
example[3]: I usually have a few days’ leave in hand at the end of the year.
definition[3]: if a team or player has a game in hand in a competition, they still have another game to play in which they could gain more points
